subject: [OT] The merits and pitfalls of dynamic languages [was: (Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful?)]
msgSnippet: ... Cedric -- please download a version of Smalltalk with an implementation of the RefactoringBrowser in it. Use it for a while, then come back and let us know
messageBody:
On 02/07/2006 11:25 AM, Cédric Beust ♔ apparently said:
> On 2/7/06, Daryl Richter <daryl@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > > So is mine, and they're both plagued by this problem.
> >
> > C'mon Cedric. Have you really done serious Smalltalk coding? I am
> > not implying there weren't challenges, but this was *never* one of
> > them.
>
>
> Because back then, nobody minded doing refactoring with string replaces...
>
> The requirements and expectations today are quite more stringent.

Cedric -- please download a version of Smalltalk with an implementation
of the RefactoringBrowser in it. Use it for a while, then come back and
let us know what you think. Remember, the idea of a refactoring tool
came straight out of Smalltalk.

--
Jason Rogers

I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me.
Galatians 2:20
